extendedIngredients.name: baby beets
extendedIngredients.original: 2 pounds baby beets, preferably a mix of golden, Chioggia and red beets
extendedIngredients.originalName: baby beets, preferably a mix of golden, Chioggia and red beets

extendedIngredients.name: brioche
extendedIngredients.original: 4 ounces brioche, cut into 3/4-inch cubes (2 cups) or into thin slices
extendedIngredients.originalName: brioche, cut into 3/4-inch cubes (2 cups) or into thin slices
meta: cut into 3/4-inch cubes (2 cups) or into thin slices

extendedIngredients.name: sorrel
extendedIngredients.original: 3 cups sorrel, preferably red ribbon (see Note)

title: Beet-and-Red Sorrel Salad with Pistachio
summary: Beet-and-Red Sorrel Salad with Pistachio might be just the side dish you are searching for. This recipe makes 6 servings with 245 calories, 6g of protein, and 14g of fat each. For $1.77 per serving, this recipe covers 10% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. It is a good option if you're following a vegan diet. If you have pistachio oil, sorrel, brioche, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 2 hours. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 50%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes include Sorrel Pistachio Pesto with Seared Salmon, Roasted Beet And Pistachio Salad, and Green Bean Beet and Pistachio Salad.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350. Spread the beets in a baking dish. Add 1/2 cup of water and cover with foil. Roast for 1 1/2 hours until tender. Let cool, then peel the beets and cut into wedges and slices. Transfer to a bowl.                                              Meanwhile, spread the brioche cubes on a baking sheet and toast for about 8 minutes, until the cubes are golden.                                              In a blender, combine the pistachios with 3/4 cup of water and blend at high speed for 1 minute. Strain the sauce into a small bowl and refrigerate until chilled. (It will thicken slightly as it chills.) Season the sauce with salt and pepper.                                              In a small bowl, whisk the olive oil with the pistachio oil and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Toss 3 tablespoons of the vinaigrette with the beets. Spoon the pistachio sauce onto plates. Mound the beets in the center and top with the sorrel. Drizzle the remaining vinaigrette all around and garnish with the brioche croutons. Serve right away.

steps.step: Spread the beets in a baking dish.
Add 1/2 cup of water and cover with foil. Roast for 1 1/2 hours until tender.
Let cool, then peel the beets and cut into wedges and slices.
Meanwhile, spread the brioche cubes on a baking sheet and toast for about 8 minutes, until the cubes are golden.

In a blender, combine the pistachios with 3/4 cup of water and blend at high speed for 1 minute. Strain the sauce into a small bowl and refrigerate until chilled. (It will thicken slightly as it chills.) Season the sauce with salt and pepper.

In a small bowl, whisk the olive oil with the pistachio oil and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Toss 3 tablespoons of the vinaigrette with the beets. Spoon the pistachio sauce onto plates. Mound the beets in the center and top with the sorrel.
Drizzle the remaining vinaigrette all around and garnish with the brioche croutons.
